name: Hotel Condor

reviews.title: Perfetto!!
reviews.text: As my sicilian friend said 'its like staying in your house' because its a clean, comfortable, friendly family run hotel.
I have stayed in many big 3* plus hotels in Taormina and none compare to Hotel Condor, I will definately be visiting again.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

likes.liked: — Family and friendly run Hotel in heart of city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights from 10th-13th August. There were 4 of us - 2 couples. This hotel is run by a family and the staff are so friendly. They couldn't have helped you any better. We hired a car out so the moment we arrived at the hotel our car was driven to their own locked up car park which cost us an additional cost of €10 per night. They also delivered the car back to us whenever we needed it during the day. We had a room with an amazing view of the town of Taormina and seaside. We paid an additional cost of €8 per night for this room but it was well worth it. It had a small enough balcony but it was suffice for our stay here. The Hotel is only a 3 minute walk to the main shopping street of Taormina. The only downfall was that it had no pool but with the beach being so near we got the cable car there whcih brought us right to the beach front. The hotel recommended us to eat at a nearby restaurant the first night (sorry cannot think of the name of restaurant but it was on your right hand side of the street when you come out of the arch and just before sport shop). Our meal was ok- nothing to write home about and cost us €130 for 4 of us with 1 drink each and only starters and main course whcih was a bit of a ripoff. Other than that we all would stay at this hotel and would highly recommend it to any future traveller to Taormina.
reviews.title: Okay stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I actually was a bit disappointed with the Hotel Condor. I had read several reviews on Trip Advisor and in books which gave me high hopes that we were going to be in for a treat. Our major disappointment was the bathroom. It was so tiny - I promise it was no bigger than 3' X 3'! The water from the shower sprayed everywhere and soaked the floor - thank goodness there was a drain! But, it was annoying to step out of the shower into about an inch of water! And, the toilet leaked when you flushed it. The other disappointing thing was that the A/C went out at 1:30am one morning! So, we were a bit hot that night, even though we were able to open the window. Other than that, it was all okay. It was not far to walk to the main streets and the view was gorgeous.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: We spent a week in Taormina at Hotel Condor at the beginning of July. We had a warm welcome from the reception staff which gave us a lot of tips and info regarding the town and the various activities( excursions, shows, places to see), the room was clean and comfortable, breakfast is served on the terrace with fantastic view of the sea. The thing we appreciated a lot was the location: just 5 minutes walking distance from everything.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel near central Taormina

likes.liked: — The staff were wonderful and helpful
likes.disliked: — It would have been difficult for someone with limited mobility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights in May. Great little family run hotel. Walking distance to the town centre. Our room was very small, but clean. We had a view on the sea. The shower was tiny, that was the only complaint of the hotel. We had to park a little up the road for 10Euro a day. Breakfast is simple, but great view. Taormina is stunning! A real gem.
reviews.title: Great Service, lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited April 18-Apr 24, 2008
reviews.title: Very comfortable Hotel

reviews.text: The Sparta Family were very friendly and helpful. Wonderful location!!! Close to shopping and restaurants. The hotel has a wonderful view and Internet access. The breakfast was served on the Terrace overlooking the beautiful sea and mountains. The breakfast was the best we had in our 3 week stay in Italy. (We stayed 6 nights in Hotel Condor).
reviews.title: ItalyLover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel to my friends and would certainly return there when I visit Italy again.
reviews.title: Nice but needs some basic upgrades

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: John & JoAnn C.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Condor

likes.liked: — Closeness to the main street and activitiesl.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't say enough good things about Hotel Condor. Every single person at the hotel was friendly and extremely helpful. Our room had a balcony with a sea view (highly recommended) and each morning we opened the doors to hear the birds and watch the sunrise. It is just a short walk into the busy section of Taormina and we really enjoyed being able to walk back after dinner at night and be in a quieter section of the town. The value for this location is absolutely unbelievable. They also have an internet station just outside of the lobby which was really helpful and convenient. We highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely a great place for a quiet Taormina experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was nice. Room was very clean. The whole hotel is tiled. Make sure you request a room that is not located underneath the stair case, as the sound travels. Owners were very nice and very accommodating, Breakfast was good. Good location. Very easy, short walk to the center of things.
reviews.title: A nice place

reviews.text: I did hear the barking dogs mentioned in other reviews, but you would hear them anywhere you stayed on the mountain side!
reviews.title: Nice place to stay, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Condor is difficult to find from the directions given - the "gates" they speak about are more like arch ways. The first one they tell you to pass is obvious, but, trying to maneuver on the tiny, steep inclines, while avoiding pedestrians, you're likely to miss the 2nd "gate" on the right, which is the one you're supposed to go through.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great Taormina value

likes.disliked: — The 70's retro orange colour of Bathroom tiles

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can get better rates going directly to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.text: This is a good hotel especially for the cost - reasonable prices are hard to come by in Taormina in the high season. It`s in a fairly quiet area, above the town centre, but not too far and the walk up isn`t very steep. We chose what they call the `Apartment` instead of two separate rooms and we thought this would be just one large room, but in fact is exactly what it says. A self-contained two bedroomed ground-floor flat a few yards from the hotel; you just have to walk over for breakfast or a drink on the terrace. The apartment was average, neither good nor bad. The main bedroom has air-conditioning (a bit noisy) and it`s got a small balcony from where you have a (limited) view of the sea. The apartment has got a washing machine which can be a good or bad thing depending on your point of view (all work and no play): we found it very useful. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and most spoke good English. Breakfast is the kind they bring to you in a basket - bread rolls, cheese, croissants, jam, that type of thing. All quite nice, although the orange `juice` tasted suspiciously like squash - didn`t bother us, though. The hotel have some sort of link with one of the lidos (la Pigne) in Mazarro and for 10 Euros per person you can have a sunbed for the day and transport to and from the beach (that alone saves you 3.50 each on the cable car). All in all a perfectly good two star hotel and I would recommend it.
reviews.title: A nice hotel for the price

reviews.text: My girfriend and me stay at the Hotel Condor in Taormina for a week and we love so much all the esperience.
reviews.title: Amazing view from the terrace of Hotel Condor

likes.liked: — The terrace where breakfast was served

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoy the time in Taormina and we had a fantastic and relaxing stay in our hotel w this beautiful terrace over looking the town and the sea.
reviews.title: Service with a smile

likes.disliked: — It's a pity that some of views are (only slightly) spoiled by the ubiquitous satellite dishes

reviews.text: The breakfast was served every morning in this terrace full of plants and wonderful flowers and feel like in haven overlooking the view.
reviews.title: Fantastic - Best For Those On A Budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was amazing and helpful for any informations we asked.
reviews.title: Lovely views, nice hotel

description: Condor Hotel, built on 1968, is owned by the Spartà-Longo family which made the ideal place to spend a pleasant holiday in Taormina in a warm familiar atmosphere. Its location is just 200 meters from the historical centre but away from the noise and the main traffic roads.The hotel is situated within 4 minutes walking distance to the cableway to the beach, the taxi station and within 8 minutes to the Greek-Roman Theatre, the Public Gardens, the panoramic Main Square and the Terminal bus, from where you can get connections to the Train Station ( 3 Km away ) and Catania Airport ( 50 Km away ).
